title: Drawing, "Design for a Mantelpiece, with Antique Bas-Relief of Antinous, in the Villa Albani, Rome;  Elevation and Ground Plan", 1755–57
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, graphite on off-white laid paper
markings:
Marks: Tracing mounted under drawing- Strasburg Lily
Stamps: Lower left (in black ink): Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union [Lugt 457d]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Surmounted by a central eagle, floral garland, and corner vases, the overmantel, presented as an elevation, contains an antique relief of Antinous. The chimneypiece and fire screen below are decorated by garlands, rosettes, and shells. A man approaches from the left. Below is the plan of the mantelpiece and fireplace.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Mantelpiece, with Antique Bas-Relief of Antinous, in the Villa Albani, Rome;  Elevation and Ground Plan", 1755–57.
1755–57. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, graphite on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1327.
